alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 4:16PM AKST until January 25 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches, except 4 to 8 inches along the Alaska Range. Total ice accumulation up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will overspread the basin from south to north overnight tonight, with the heaviest precipitation expected Wednesday morning. Warm air will surge into the southern Copper River Basin leading to areas of rain or freezing rain. Precipitation north of Glennallen up to the Alaska Range is expected to fall mainly as snow. Glennallen will be right in the middle and will likely see a mix of snow and rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
